data.title: For 60 Bucks you cant beat it
data.text: We come to Akron once a year  and always stay here.  It has had a new name almost every year...but  for the money you always get a clean room and friendly service.  We will continue to stay here.   I always read the other reviews and am surprised at what people seem to expect at this price point.   I would recomend

data.title: Cheap, Clean, Friendly
data.text: I stayed at this hotel 2 weeks ago. I was a little nervous based on some of the previous reviews but I couldn't beat the price. I have to say, I appreciate the hotels frankness. They were honest about the pool, restaurant, fitness center on the website and when I checked in, the desk agent told me that was the reason they had dropped their prices. My room was clean, everything worked and I saved a lot of money. I would say, give this hotel a try. No frills, dated but I only needed a place to sleep while I was visiting my son who attends U of Akron.

data.title: lost my reservation
data.text: I called 2 weeks prior to my stay and the hotel lost my reservation and really wasn't willing to help out.  The manager told me he would call me back by the end of the day Friday never called me back when I called Monday I couldn't get a hold of the same person and some other guy called back.  I read the reviews and saw it wasn't a nice place to stay but I figured it would be a cheap place to lay my head but I guess not.

data.title: Hotelsone.com intrusion into my call to a 24 hour hotel desk.
data.text:
Rodeway Inn was Akron City Center Hotel in Feb 2016. Hotelsone.com was the big problem.  My phone call to ACC Hotel, a 24 hour desk was (intercepted) by Hotelsone.com. While ACC Hotel had timely refunds, my receipt from Hotelsone.com
came back (NON-REFUNDABLE). The fight was on. Citicard kept the billing alive until
June 30. Hotelsone.com said conditions were not met by me even though I never had received them until Citicard provided them. Eventually I timely cancelled my hotel stay.
Went to beautiful Comfort Inn, Hartville.  ACC Hotel/now Rodeway cooperated just fine

data.title: Sleepless in Akron
data.text: worst beds ever.  Told the beds were queen when they were full.  when asked they said that is what we consider queen.  beds were broken down.  Non caring staff.  place is filthy.  toilet had toilet paper in it when came to first use.  Never again.  When complained was told the beds were made exclusively for the Raddison.  Do everyone a favor and leave them in the junkyard where they belong.

data.title: Never stay here. EVER.
data.text:
The night I stayed at this hotel was by far the worst hotel experience of my life.

The a/c did nothing to keep the room cool, we woke up sweating with the a/c up as high as it would go. There was hair in the tub drain, dirty underwear in the closet, and blood stains on the comforter. 

We also had a horrible experience at check-in. Apparently the night desk person doesn't do a lot of check-ins. He walked away from the desk as I approached it, saying he would be right back. He took a few minutes to return with nobody else there, so he wasn't taking care of another guest. Then, after spending several minutes going between the computer and some papers, he said he had to start the whole process again. It took at least 10-15 minutes to get checked in. As if that wasn't bad enough, we arrived at 12:15am after a long drive from St. Louis.

But all of this wasn't even the worst of it. At 4 a.m. we had someone walk in our room. He turned on the light and walked right in. I sat up in bed and asked why he was there. He just said "oops, wrong room" and left. No apology or explanation, and he left the light on. He did say he was from the front desk or I would have called the police, which I should have done anyway. I only chose not to because we had to be up 2 hours after that and I needed sleep.

I am beyond disappointed in this experience. The only good thing about the stay was the free weekend parking. I can't believe that Choice Hotels would allow their name to be associated with a hotel like this. I will certainly not return. Just stay anywhere else. Sleep in your car and shower at a truck stop, it will be a better experience.

data.title: The worst experience ever
data.text: Filthy.  Poorly to absolute zero trained staff.  Top all that off with they charged my one night / two room stay for two nights.  Despite faxes, phone calls and pleading on at least 12 separate occassions, they have not issued my credit.  I have filed a dispute procedure with my American Express card and have filed a complaint with the BBB.  Do yourself a favor and steer clear of this place.

data.title: No brown water
data.text: My husband and I stayed here this weekend for one night.  While the hotel is definitely tired and in need of updates, the staff was very kind and accommodating.  Upon our arrival, Donna at the front desk could not be have been nicer.  It is our understanding that the hotel is under renovations and we wish them the best in the future.  The most frustrating part for us was the parking garage.  The garage needs more signage directing the customer to the hotel level.  We spent 1/2 hour trying to get what we needed to be ... Hopefully new management addresses this issue.

data.title: Night of my life i'm not getting back
data.text: Was in Akron on business and booked here due to the proximity to my morning meeting.  Arrived late with a colleague and found the front dest guy half asleep.  As stated in other reviews, the hotel was FREEZING.  Despite having a reservation in hand and pre-paid, he could not locate our reservation.  Once we got into our respective rooms, my colleagues room had no hot water, while my shower did not have a handle!  After calling down to the front desk and explaining my situation, he stated he would come up with another key and move me to another room.  No apology so far.  20 mins later i had to call down again.  I was finally moved into another room that felt like the heat had not been turned on. Since i had been travelling the whole day and needed a shower, i was thankful this shower had a handle until i turned on the water and it came out brown.  Three minutes later it was mostly clear and only lukewarm.  I accepted this as the "best i would get" this evening because i was not willing to continue playing musical chairs and bounced to another room.  Keep in mind this was 2:15am. I wish there was a way for me to rate it ZERO stars.  Why is this place, in a central location in town so horrible and still in business?!?

data.title: valentine's day 2016
data.text: we reserved a room here for its location.when we arrived the person at the front desk wasn't sure what room we were to have there was 2 on the key card.after about 15 minutes we had a room. IT WAS FREEZING in the room and in the building! we called down for another room with heat.we got it about an hour later.the tv remote didn't work, the sleep number bed didn't work, the ice machine and pop machine on our floor didn't work. the machine on another floor had outdated pop in it and it was sold out of everything, the restaurant was closed.

data.title: Reminds me of "The Shinning"
data.text: My husband and I went there last night and was welcomed into a dark gloomy lobby with NO HEAT. Got our room and the key card wouldn't work. Went back down to get another one and someone else was down there complaining about the water being brown. We go back up to our room and the key card doesn't work again. We ended up moving rooms. Again key card wouldn't work. Finally we get and half our lights wouldn't work. No big deal wasn't really there for the lighting. The wall paper was peeling away from the walls, the Tv was an old box tube tv and no mini fridge. And we got the Superior room with Jacuzzi. You would think the would have done better. The website says they have theses amazing sleep number beds, well mine didn't work and the bed was broken. Worst place ever!

data.title: Terrible is an understatement
data.text: As others have said the lights in the hallways do not work so the entire common area is dark and gloomy, the ac in the room worked when it felt like it.  Had to get up and turn it off let it sit and turn it back on to get it to work for 30-45 min.  The fixtures in the bathroom where broken and there was a huge hairball on the floor disgusting.

owner_response.author: Larry R, General Manager at Rodeway Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about our shortcomings.  We apologize.  No excuses.  The new management team here has been working hard to address the guest comfort issues you mentioned.  We sincerely appreciate your honest feedback and hope you will give us another try in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fading Fast
data.text:
Akron City Center Hotel is a downtown hotel that was once a great facility. I have used this facility with a small group for the last 3 years due to its location on the Tow Path.  For whatever reason, partly I am certain because of new ownership, the hotel is fading fast.  With more than a dozen floors, only one was being used for guests during my most recent stay.  The management has changed each of those 3 years.  Air conditioning was kept off in the halls and rooms until you took occupancy.  Halls and rooms were in the 80's or 90;s.  Of the five rooms rented, 2 had to be reassigned due to weak or non-functioning AC.  The AC in my room went out somewhere between 2:30 and 4:00 A.M. and my security latch on the door was not working.  I packed up and went down to the lobby for the duration of the evening.  I had trouble reasoning with the foreign counter agent who argued with me, rationalized and begrudgingly removed the charges for 1 of the 5 rooms.  Other front desk personnel were helpful and kind, but there was either technology failure or incompetence from check-in to check-out.

Our group was the only evidence of life in this multi-story hotel.  The carpets were dirty throughout the entire facility.  SO MUCH POTENTIAL, SO LITTLE VALUE. If someone does not rescue this hotel soon it will be a vacant ruins soon.

owner_response.author: Larry R, General Manager at Rodeway Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I sincerely apologize for your very uncomfortable stay and certainly understand your feelings.  Your description hit the nail on the head.  Since your departure, the new management team here has been working hard with ownership to address all of the items you mentioned.  We have made progress and have applied for renovation funding.

My hope is that you'll give us another try if and when you return to Akron.  Thank you for your honest comments.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Terrible is correct
data.text: No lights in hallways, no a/c in lobby or hallways. Only floor with lights on was 9th. Bistro was closed, pool closed, ice machine broken... One elevation worked with bad key card swiper, room was stale, a/c couldn't keep up with 90 degree hallway, closet door broken, desk broken, carpet wavey.... need I say more- the guy working at the front desk was nice but unequipped to help.

owner_response.author: Larry R, General Manager at Rodeway Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your comments regarding this hotel's shortcomings.  We sincerely apologize.  Since your stay, the new management team has been working diligently to correct the items mentioned.  Our restaurant and lounge are closed now for renovations. Our pool will be reopening within the next two weeks.  We are retraining our Front Desk staff and because of this they are much more professional. 

Please give us another chance on a return trip to Akron.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Convenient, but Uncomfortable
data.text:
I'm guessing at some point, this was a really nice hotel. But the fact that at $89 a night in downtown Akron should have a good indication. When I arrived, the AC was not on and the hallways were dark. The rooms had a lot to be desired; peeling wallpaper, leaking windows, lumpy beds. 
Week one, they lost my reservation made by my company. Week two, they overcharged me (which I don't know if they've corrected yet). Week three, lost my company info for checking me out. They did everything on hard copy, no computer system.
The Wi-Fi was free, but unsecured. Their website has not been updated in years. There is a bar/restaurant on the third floor which I was told hasn't been open in at least two years.
There is free parking and the majority of the staff was helpful, but untrained. Again, it was convenient, but I would not stay here again.

data.title: Not as bad as everyone says
data.text: Ok, it is by no means a 5 star hotel. Probably a 2-3. Went on saturday in august. Lobby, hot and dark. Pool, closed. Two people at desk, very nice. Parking garage, desolate. But, none of that is horrible, just not 5 star. So, first room, not so hot. I don't think anyone actually stayed in it for months. 14th floor. Toilet had brown water, and wierd little bugs. Flushed it, still brown. Bath, same thing, gross brown water. So, we asked for another room. Finally got one after about 20 min, not horrible wait, but still. Second room was great (12th fl), if we didn't see the first it would have been awesome. But, this was good, air conditioner worked, bath and toilet was clean. Bed worked, tv was old but worked. Worth 90 bucks, no, but was in walking distance of Lock 3 where we wanted to go for hamburger Festival. For one night it was fine. Only hotel in town, so if you are visiting for the theater or the Rubber Ducks baseball game, a good place. Just don't expect 5 star and ask for a newer room. Oh, last thing, they only use a few floors, stopped at 5th and it was pitch black. Not as bad as everyone is saying, not that the are lying, but we had an ok experience. Next time, maybe we will stay outside of town for better hotel.

data.title: If I could give this 0 stars I would.
data.text: In June, I booked a room at this hotel so I'd have a place to stay after a concert I was going to in the area. Despite the fact that I was there WITH MY CONFIRMATION EMAIL IN HAND, I was told there were no rooms. The girl behind the counter was completely clueless and when we asked for the manager it took her a good 10 minutes to show up. She told me the system crashed and they had no record of my reservation. There was zero effort to help us in any way. Someone needs to teach these people what HOSPITALITY is because this hotel has no clue what that means. And since it's Football Hall of Fame weekend, there were no other hotel rooms to be had anywhere. We ended up driving the 3 hours all the way back home.

data.title: NEVER STAYING AGAIN!!!
data.text: Worst hotel experience EVER!  Wish I'd have read some of these reviews before deciding to stay at this place.  The only positive aspect was the location because we could walk to the Akron Civic Theater for our concert.  First we had a horrible time finding this place.  We finally find it & get parked & head into the lobby.  It was 90 & humid out & there was absolutely no air conditioning in the lobby or any of the hallways or elevators.  The girl at the front desk had about 6 fans going.  There was a couple in front of us checking in & by the time we got checked in & headed to the elevator they were back...the room they were given was already occupied by someone else!  I cringed as we got into the dark elevator to head up to our room.  What a dump!  Sleep number beds didn't work, mold on the bathroom ceiling, plugged sink, someone's fingernail clippers left between the bed & nightstand along with a room key, air conditioning in the room barely worked, some sort of hairball on the floor outside the bathroom, no remote to be found for the 1987 tv & the list goes on & on!  They advertise a pool & a restaurant/bar.  The pool was closed for maintenance (I'm assuming it's prob been years since they had a pool) & we never encountered the restaurant/bar being open.  I didn't get to sleep till almost 3am & by 6:30am I was up & ready to head home!  We got no bill under our door so we called down to say we were leaving.  She said if we didn't receive a bill we had to come down to the front desk.  The check out process took over 45 minutes.  There were 2 people in front of us & 4 or 5 behind.  Everyone seemed pretty disgusted by the whole ordeal.  I've never in my life paid that much to stay somewhere so crappy!  It wasn't worth more than $49.99 a night in my opinion!!!  As we were all struggling through the checking out another hotel employee showed up & thought it was hilarious we were all standing around sweating to death as we waited to leave.  He even joked about them only having one computer that worked.  THIS PLACE WAS A COMPLETE DUMP - I'D HIGHLY RECOMMEND STAYING OUTSIDE OF THE CITY & JUST DRIVING IN FOR WHATEVER YOU'RE THERE FOR!  The AAA rating is also a joke because no way in the world would any representative for AAA step foot in there!

data.title: Creepy and dirty hotel
data.text:
Stayed one night in a jacuzzi "suite" on the 9th floor. Stood in the front lobby for ten minutes waiting to check-in. I should have walked out and never looked back! The girl at the front desk finally showed up, out of breath and sweaty, apologizing and saying she had to go to the bank before it closed which is why she wasn't there. 
Everything was dated, creepy, dirty. The room had a old TV, no DVD player, no channel guide and the remote didn't work. When I called to find out about moving rooms, the line just rang until it disconnected me. I called 3 times with no luck of talking to someone. 
The jacuzzi was filthy, covered in hair, nail polish streaks (gross) and God knows what else. When I got the surface cleaned, I turned the jets on and black "stuff" shot out everywhere. 
The pillows smelled like sweat. The door didn't have a bolt lock. We only had 3 towels. Every other floor in the hotel was shut down, no lights, no electricity. Had to go on an adventure to find ice and had more luck passing rooms that stuck up the hall with marijuana smoke. The stairwells stunk of smoke and there were snuffed out cigarettes on the ground.
If I could have gotten the staff to answer the phone, I would have demanded a refund and left, although it seems I wouldn't have been successful from reading these other reviews; on a side note, I realize I should have read these reviews before subjecting myself to the terror of staying at this run down ghetto hotel.

data.title: hotel horror
data.text: Had to call 911 …..The worst hotel experience ever.After checking in the room was filthy and the toilet was black.They gave me another room and that one was even more GROSS.I finally told them I want my money back and they refused.
